Reviews.Title: “Good serviced apartment”
Reviews.Author: ss_hoo
Reviews.Content: Booked 2-bedroom apartment and 1 studio apartment. Spent 3 nights in Sydyney. Room clean and serviced daily. Great location to explore CBD area. walking distance to chinatown and Paddy market.. But got air-con issue for the studio apartment, So went down to the reception to complain middle of the night. Managed to change to another room, but still having air-con issue, stuffy and plus can hear the water running through the paip whole night. Finally problem resolved when changed to the third studio room. Overall no issue for the 2-bedroom apartment. Thanks to front desk helping me to check in our flight to Melbourne.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: Ironships
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nice apartment with washer dryer which is handy with kids in tow. Handy to train station for access to rest of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: maxwell13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 12 nights in a loft apartment. The apartment was great it was clean and serviced daily. Although it's next door to Central Station there was no noise. A good location to explore the city from. The staff were excellent, especially the night we had a Huntsman spider on our balcony, which they removed for us very promptly. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position”
Reviews.Author: Rachel G
Reviews.Content: The position of this hotel for our sight seeing needs was perfect as we were attending exhibits at the Powerhouse Museum so it was within easy walking distance. Central station was only a short walk through the tunnel which was right outside the hotel. Bus stops on opposite side of road. Beautiful cafe/resturant connected to the hotel, coffee shops and convinence store in courtyard next to the hotel. Staff friendly and helpful. The pool area clean. Lifts fast. We had a 2 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment which was clean and view onto shop courtyard. No traffic noise heard, very busy area. From the airport to the city the train is approximately $15 adult, cab $30 (not in peak hour), shuttle bus to hotel door was $60 for 4 .

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary experience”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan
Reviews.Content: We have traveled a lot and have been occasionally upgraded, but nothing like what happened to us at the Medina Executive. I only hope their customer service executive sees this and appreciates the outstanding job his staff did for us. Obviously, we wouldn't suggest this would be everyone's experience, but here goes. We had reserved the room for a Tuesday night (after a cruise) through wotif.com, a discount hotel website that sometimes has discounts (you have to keep checking). Since rooms in Sydney are generally pricey, this single room (it is an apartment-hotel) was about $175 and through wotif included late check-out and a bottle of wine. However, we arrived at 9 a.m. and check-in wasn't until 1 or 2 p.m. So I smilingly asked the desk clerk if we could check in early instead of out late. Without blinking an eye, she looked at her list and told us that we couldn't get into our reserved room early. However, they had a 2 bedroom, 2 bath unit that she would be glad to upgrade us to for the night. Huh? Just like that. We retrieved a luggage cart, piled on our 3-weeks worth of stuff, and went up to our "apartment". I really don't know what this would have cost, but if you needed a place for a family, this was perfect. Master bedroom (king bed) with ensuite full bath (large), second bedroom with 2 twins and full bath outside. Complete kitchen, including dishwasher. Living/dining area with sofa, coffee table, flat screen, dining table and chairs. Separate flat screen in master (although mounted up near ceiling for some reason). Oh, and a washer and dryer in the second bathroom. No charge, except for soap (bring your own). Clean, with furniture in good shape. Only caveat is that showers are over bathtubs, and bathtubs are quite a climb into. Big step. Quiet room. Hotel is in a busy area, but didn't hear any noise. Was about a $20 taxi ride from whart. Going to the international airport the next morning, the hotel arranged a shuttle at $14 per person, and the shuttle was right on time and took about 15 minutes. Lots of shops and restaurants in the area, which is Haymarket. We had been to Sydney before, so we walked around Chinatown (about 5-10 minutes) and surrounding areas. The hotel is also about 5-10 minutes from the central bus depot, and there is a free shuttle that goes around the Central Business District (CBD). Just be sure to get on the shuttle across the street from the terminal and look for the green 555 sign. Did not eat at the hotel, but plenty of places around. The staff were extermely courteous, and there seemed to be lots of business people there. The 5 stars is for our particular experience, but I would go back the next time I was in Sydney without thinking about it twice.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: 54ann
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Feb 2012. The room was small, the mattress and pillows like rock, bathroom very basic with minimal cheap toiletries, NO room service. You had to order take in food, which was also expensive. Double glazing on windows excellent, so a quiet room even though on a busy street. For $300 a night I expected a lot better. Would never stay here again or recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Gyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in these apartments for a couple of nights in Feb. They are in an excellent location on the main street with lots of restaurants nearby. The apartments themselves could have been cleaner, as they are classing them as executive apartments I would have expected the standards to be higher.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and reasonable hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: Lynsey K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel/apartments in feb 2012. We arrived early hours, there was someone avaliable to check us in without a problem. The hotel entrance and Libby area was clean tidy and modern as were the corridors and our room. The standard room we booked was a reasonable size, and was equip with a small kitchenette area neatly hidden behind a wardrobe style door. The area had a micro wave, toaster, kettell, fridge area which as doubled as a mini bar (chargeable) and a sink. All crockery and cutlery was provided. Very well equip, space to eat anything you may make is however limited. The bathroom was clean and modern no bath but a large short cubical. Towels are changed daily if required. Rooms have aircon and wifi is avaliable but very expensive to use. Standard rooms do jot have a balcony. There is a pleasant pool area which, it's small but private and very clean, chairs loungers abd fresh towels are avaliable. There 'gym' area is just three peices of equipment, but is avaliable for all guests towels and water were provided. The hotel was nice and little to grumble about, there was a small resturant area attached to the hotel, however we didn't use this area. Breakfast packages were also avaliable to purchase from reception. The staff were friendly, personally speaking I found most of them were foreign, and some struggled with the language barrier. Particually when asking for directions and locations. The hotel is in a great location, situated right by central station for the rail network, within walking distance of darling harbour and the free bus which you can get in to circular quay near the opera house. Would recommend,

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families”
Reviews.Author: MannersPlsCanberra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Feb 2012. We stayed here with extended family - so 4 adults and 2 small children. The staff were all consistently polite and helpful. The rooms were just lovely and the kitchen and living room splendid. The pool is outdoor and is in a lovely and modern setting with a jacuzzi on the side. It's heated! Great for kids. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Linda from Ireland”
Reviews.Author: linda f
Reviews.Content: Booked a 'studiio apartment'- what a euphimism! It is in fact a small hotel room with a sink and a microwave hidden in a wardrobe! No couch or easy chairs, just a little table and 2 chairs. We had gone to great trouble to check up on apartments in Sydney and nowhere in the 'speil' on the Medina did they mention that there was in fact no studio apartment. After one look we moved to a 1 bedroom apartment, for which we paid an extra $30 per night One bedroom apartment was fine. Quite roomy and most necessaries supplied.

Reviews.Title: “Brillant Location Sydney CBD”
Reviews.Author: CazzNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 b/r 2 bathroom apartment for 4 nights and we were very impressed. We had booked early so managed to get a good deal, Staff were very friendly and courteous, you are just a 3 min walk from the train station and you can jump on the City Circle free bus to get down to Circular Quay. We were there to see the Rod Stewart concert and it was only a 10 min maximum walk to the Entertainment Centre. You can get the train from the airport to Central Station in about 10 mins, the tickets are a rip off for that at $15 per person but the convenience is great. Its about $60 to get a taxi and takes so much longer, so I suppose that makes the airport train better. Oh and Paddys Market and Chinatown are just about on your doorstep too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maxim3m
Reviews.Content: We arrived at0900 and were checked in and our baggage stored as obviously the room wasn't ready. We were here for a week so we went next door to central station and purchased one week tickets for ferry, train, bus and tram and went down to Circular quay for a wander. We then did some food shopping and got back to Medina at about 1300 and were allocated our room - upgrade to loft. The room was excellent, clean and tidy with superb facilities. Our room fronted the main road but was not noisy. The only problems we found were. O ironing board and a faulty kettle - these problems were rectified immediately we notified reception. My only slight moan was that more than two pans would have made cooking easier- we still managed ok. I would definitely use these apartments again.

Reviews.Title: “Great postion in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: ushy
Reviews.Content: I have just spent 4 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment at Medina Sydney Central. As with other properties that I have stayed in with Medina (Medina on Flinders Melbourne and in St Kilda).they offer a great space to relax. My room on the 5th floor was exceptionally quiet considering the busy intersection outside the hotel. It had all we needed in the room and although a little tired, was very clean and well presented. The pool downstairs looked great although we didn't find time to use it. There are plenty of places just around the corner to buy basic bread, milk and groceries and Chinatown is a 5 minute walk away with more supermarkets and bottle shops and Market City for fresh fruit. I do have a real issue however with Medina continuing to charge $25 a day for internet use,. Its about time in Australia we started offering this as a service in all properties. there is a Gloria Jeans across the road where you can access the net for the price of a cup of coffee. And Medina is only a 5 minute walk to Central station and a 10 minute walk to Darling Harbour so in a great position. Overall, a great spot whilst staying in Sydney. whilkst

Reviews.Title: “Worth staying in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: tia F
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Sydney, very tidy, quiet and the staff show everything you need to enjoy the best Sydney has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with stay”
Reviews.Author: ilovepythagoras
Reviews.Content: I booked a 1 bedroom apartment with full kitchen for 5 nights on wotif.com at a reasonable price. There were 3 of us ... 2 adults plus a 3 year old child. Arriving to check in at 10pm, we were provided with an upgrade to a loft apartment. We were extremely happy with our apartment. My priorities are cleanliness and safety. The bathroom, kitchen and apartment in general were very clean. No problems with swipe cards to access lift and room. We're pretty tidy when travelling, but the apartment was cleaned regularly, including the bathroom being wiped down daily ... A cleaner even unloaded our dishwasher, even though this wasn't an expectation. We were very fortunate to have a small balcony that faced north. Being able to sit outside and enjoy the city was great. Despite being noisy whilst sitting on the balcony (not a problem, we're in the middle of the city after all!), the apartment was very quiet when the balcony doors were shut. Also nice to open the balcony doors to let in a breeze to cool the room. The loft next to us had a similar balcony with access but no view as the fascade of the building ran the length of the balcony, which rendered the balcony useless if you wanted to sit outside. Still able to open doors for a cooling breeze. Consider this when making a loft booking. I made use of the washing machine ... It was clean and seemed in excellent condition. I also used the dishwasher, and was clean and working. I didn't make use of the oven or stove. We used the airconditioning quite a bit to cool the loft. Both the vents upstairs and downstairs worked effectively. It's a large space to cool, but keeping the blinds and curtains shut helped and we were most comfortable. Some of the scrim curtaining was ripped, obviously by the handle of the balcony door. A little care by previous patrons would have prevented this. We pulled and tied back the curtains and had no problems. I wasn't fussed by the torn curtaining. Can't expect it to be replaced everytime a patron is careless and damages them. Of course, I would expect them to be replaced when they get pass the point of return. Stairs in our loft were a little steep, but my three year old (who has poor vision) made use of the ballustrading well, and was confidently using the stairs. I agree with zzNov314 ... "Best advice, go all the way here and get a room not at the lower end and you'll see the best it has to offer which is, actually rather good". Being an old building that has been converted within the constraints of the original wall structures means that some of the rooms may be pokey. Overall, we had an excellent trip. Full kitchen was an asset when travelling as a family. Position to Central Station was great, especially considering we travelled on the XPT and Indian Pacific, and also made use of the light tram and local train services whilst in Sydney. Lots of places to eat at from cheap and cheerful to restaurants. It was nice to stay in an 100 year old building with a bit of character than a skyscraper type building. We were fortunate and appreciative of the room upgrade. Will stay here again with the family.

Reviews.Title: “The good rooms are good... The good rooms...”
Reviews.Author: zzNov314
Reviews.Content: Having stayed here several times over the years, I've seen the best, and worst it has to offer. The lofts are charming, modern and elegant. Views are engaging, and the location is great, though, there are heaps of other places to stay around here, budget places that, frankly, aren't all that bad, for half the price. The worst rooms really are Insultingly poor by comparison. The shoebox I had on my last stay was, frankly, worse than the most budget of accommodation I've experienced in Haymarket. Small and characterless, no luggage space or racks, a bathroom that is dim and built to a DIY standard... Pay through the nose Internet, and not a spare pillow to be found anywhere. Top it off with and a constant tapping and vibration of the aircon on the wardrobe 'fixtures' so loud it actually woke me several times. Oh, and a dodgy alarm clock that went off at midnight for no apparent reason... Top night. Even the budget places down the road are better than this room, or at least, one can accept that they come with the price tag... On the positive side... Transport is very easy to come by here, and it's got 24hour food places nearby too. Best advice, go all the way here and get a room not at the lower end and you'll see the best it has to offer which is, actually rather good.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: msbaybee
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Medina Executive a number of times over the last 5-6 years. It is close to transport and relatively close to shopping at Pitt St mall. The prices are quite competitive and therefore worth every penny. The rooms are reasonably sized, they have a kitchen, lounge room and decent lighting. Although it may now be a little out-dated (I haven't been for the last few months), it's a very cosy little hotel. Would recommend for a group of friends or a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: Lin W
Reviews.Content: We were transfered to this hotel after another hotel had lost our reservation. The Medina was very accomodating. The rooms...I should say apartment was attractive, well appointed and large. The hotel does not have a restaurant but it is right downtown next to the rail station and in the business district. This renovated old post office is near the free bus service that takes you to the Central Quay and various other access points to tourist sights. Views onto the street are really interesting.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Yantz
Reviews.Content: when I book the room, I was looking for hotels near Haymerket, what I didnt realise it was also very near to the subways. I book 2 room apartment style because I am travelling with my family. it was very spacious. we can see the city from the room it is very easy to go to all the city attractions (easy to go to Sydney Harbour from the subway station). very helpful staffs, clean rooms, we thoroughly enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WoodyNZ
Reviews.Content: Minutes walk to Central station and across the street from Railway Square Bus Station makes this location ideal for getting around Sydney. Staff were polite and courteous, our apartment was all we could have wished for, clean, spacious and comfortable with all the amenities we needed. Air conditioning kept the interior temperature great in spite of the unusually high heat outside. Would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “November 2011”
Reviews.Author: George S
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in November 2011. First experience when entering the hotel was to be greeted by an indifferent receptionist. My one bedroom apartment that promised â€˜views of Sydney cityscape (George Street and Henry Dean Plaza )â€™ actually had a view of a brick wall (photos available). A small veranda with a very small table and 2 chairs and a view of a brick wall - very disappointing if a tourist. The restaurant was closed so no meals or breakfast available and when I asked why this was not stated on booking I was advised it had been closed for three months for renovations. The WiFi and cable internet was not working. There were 13 steep stairs to the bedroom and the shower was over the bath that was itself quite small. Would not recommend for anyone with any type of limitation to mobility. The bed was low and the mattress was of a lower quality compared to similar priced hotels I have stayed at in Sydney. There were two pillows and two bolster cushions on the bed when I arrived. I requested two additional pillow which did arrive in 5 minutes. There were numerous stains on the bedroom carpet that appeared unsavoury and scuff marks on the bedroom tables and walls. The air conditioner was quite noisy. On the positives. I did not use all the amenities but the washing machine and dryer located in the bathroom appeared to be in very good condition. The small kitchen had a number of pans and cooking implements, a microwave and a dishwasher which also appeared in good condition. A lot of space in the room but little substance. I would never go back as too many quality hotels in Sydney to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not much else that justifies the expense.”
Reviews.Author: Beerstud64
Reviews.Content: Overpriced dodgy contintal breakfast packs, poor basic maintenance of rooms made up for by the convenient location. If you don't need the convenience of the train station, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,bad room”
Reviews.Author: Tui08
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic,but I was disappointed with the room. The windows were permmantly closed and the air conditioning didn't work that well. Considering it was a four star hotel I was expecting a little bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great room & location at a keen price”
Reviews.Author: rwps
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the loft rooms, and had a great view, lots of light and a spacious room. Though the noise carried through the room due to open mezzanine layout for the upstairs bedroom, it was nice to have the high ceilings for a sense of space in front of the mezzanine section. Pool was perfect for a few laps or a splash with a child - surrounded by nice greenery too. If staying in a loft room, some of them have effectively a brick wall in front of the downstairs window/balcony (part of the ornate facade). Something I wasn't keen on, but was easily swapped to another room by the friendly staff. And when the clothes dryer wouldn't work they were able to repair it by putting a new drive belt in themselves really quickly - impressed! A good cafe around the back of the building called Coffee Trails was a decent spot for brekky & they had decent bread for sale too. Haymarket restaurants are right at your doorstep so a huge array to choose from. A tip in the same spot around the back of the building is a direct entry to central station.

Reviews.Title: “A good option”
Reviews.Author: natsnaps
Reviews.Content: The pros... Great location near train station and top end of Sydney. Buses and cabs stop right outside Staff are really friendly and helpful Very clean and tidy Really quiet. Even though you're next to the YHA and train station I never heard a thing. Fully booked yet no noise from other guests. The cons Rooms are tiny, the images make it look bigger due to the cropping Because the rooms are small they feel very impersonal, you feel like you're in a small cube. But....the biggie.....the bed is appalling. There is a large spring that has broken through on the left hand side but on the right hand side the bed springs have collapsed to it tilts to the floor. Didn't really get a good nights sleep

Reviews.Title: “OK room, let down by some other aspects”
Reviews.Author: fmackUk
Reviews.Content: The room I stayed in (penthouse loft) was of a decent standing overall. It came with a balcony, however there is not much to admire in terms of the view (of grimy Central Station). It is unbelievable that for $200 a night there is no breakfast included, and also very mean-spirited that I could not claim Virgin Velocity miles because 'your employer paid for the room, not you': in a decade of business travel, I have never heard of anything like that. Air conditioner could not be set above 23, which was a problem as it was cold that night. Blanket on bed looked old. Shower did not function very well (lack of pressure). It's also shocking to see that they charge you for Wi Fi and how high the fee is (again, when you're already spending $200/night). Agree with reviewers who say that the neighbourhood is a bit iffy, maybe dodgy, and definitely grimy and not pleasant. Also, that the staff seem young/inexperienced (but that seems to be the case in many hotels/hospitality businesses in Australia). I would stay again, but not at that price level, and they need to include breakfast/internet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, comfortable and courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: CJayQueensland
Reviews.Content: Having checked previous reviews on TripAdvisor I stayed at the Medina Executive and was very satisfied. The staff are very warm and welcoming and happy to oblige their patrons. That in itself had me smiling. The room was very clean and comfortable with plenty of room to relax after a busy day. The bathroom boasted a deep bath with a shower over it and also housed a washing machine and drier concealed behind a well positioned door. Considering the hotel is situated on a busy street and adjacent to Central Station I was very pleased the rooms were so quiet. I suppose on the down side, the windows didn't open, however, the rooms remained very quiet with some lovely city views at night (Sorry, couldn't see the harbour from here). As others have mentioned, the location is fabulous. Public transport is abundant with light rail, bus, monorail and trains available virtually from the front door. Having said that I chose to walk the 300 metres or so to the Sydney Entertainment Centre which is opposite Paddy's Market and around the corner from the infamous China Town. There are plenty of Asian restaurants to chose from with a variety of supermarkets and seafood and fresh food markets close by if you feel more adventurous and want to try cooking up a storm in your apartment. Unfortunately I did not use the inviting pool, gym, sauna or BBQ area, but was pleased to hear that the Medina Executive payed special attention to their guests and provided fresh towels, toiletaries and BBQ Plates and utensils for their guest's convenience. It's these little touches that I appreciate when staying in a hotel like the Medina Executive. Next time I travel to Sydney, I'll be staying at the Medina Executive again.

Reviews.Title: “Average all round”
Reviews.Author: tribalinsight
Reviews.Content: A reasonably located apartment hotel. Good that it's close to Central train station, but decor is feeling very tired. Sydney hotels have really gone downhill since the Olympics. There is a real dearth of clean, good quality, mid to high-priced hotels, which means there is a real opportunity for some developers. Probably wouldn't stay here again unless I had to be nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: AichZed
Reviews.Content: Next to central station so easy to find and get around the city from the station. Staff were friendly and helpful Apartments were clean, well set up, spacious, modern. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Jezza_M_71
Reviews.Content: Booked for a few nights through Expedia and got quite a very reasonable rate for a 1 bedroom apartment. For 3 nights it was around the $400-450 mark which I consider to be very good. Was pleasantly surprised to receive an upgrade to a Loft Apartment, the apartment was very nice the only thing I would caution is that the stairs are quite steep and a bit narrow so be careful or book a different room type if you don't have great balance. The location is a perfect place to base yourself from as it's so close to Central Station but I was surprised at how little noise there was inside the room and as it's an older building it has a bit of character to it. Staff were helpful even sewed a button back on my suit jacket for me. The only real issue I had was when I was there the cafe/restaurant in the building was not in operation but I note that it had a sign there saying it was going to reopen. I would consider staying again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: shedee
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 bedroom apartment online and the service and staff were incredibly efficient and helpful. The room was big, spacious with 2 bathrooms and the facilities were top form. Very impressed and we will definitely return. Many thanks to their front office staff, Jacob, who checked us in early and was helpful through-out our stay. The location of this hotel is ideal to Chinatown and we walked around quite a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more, would probably not be back”
Reviews.Author: essendontvl
Reviews.Content: I stay in Sydney most weeks, and normally serviced apartments as it is for a full week. Has been interesting checking out a few different properties to compare. This was my first time at the Medina Executive Sydney Central and would not rush back. Location wise is handy to central station but unfortunately there is no supermarket close by like other serviced apartments, also not a huge amount of decent restaurants in the area. I had a studio room, but basically it was a hotel room with a minbar, sink and very old and dated microwave in a cupboard. Other studios will normally have a proper kitchen or kitchenette. The daily service was also very hit and miss, they took a dirt towel one day and did not replace it and I have never seen a bed made so pool. Also the Gym does not open till 7am, which does not suit corporate travellers who normally go at 6am then off to the office. To sum it up nothing inherently bad, but I think you can do alot better in Sydney serviced apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Anubhav C
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in march this year, after trying many hotels in Sydney, I found this one to be one of the finest and certainly value for money. Let me rate it specifically: Location : Excellent , just outside the sydney central station very near to the offices in CBD. Food: Good Rooms: Very good, clean, very well maintained and comfy. Staff: Very helpful and courteous. Highly recommended for business travelers, perfectly located, nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and great value”
Reviews.Author: Yackandandah
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and roomy apartments, fantastic service and great value - what more can you say , other than thank you Medina staff - you made our holiday to Sydney just that much better,

Reviews.Title: “A great find - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Pisces_7
Reviews.Content: After searching for a decent hotel in the city area for a one night (Saturday) stay on the weekend of MardiGras I found the Medina Executive Apartments. They were happy to take a one night booking and did not appear to have hiked up their prices due to it being MardiGrasunlike most of the other hotels . I got a great deal for a studio apartment through Wotif and when I arrived at the hotel I was upgraded to a one bedroom apartment. The apartment was great and the staff were very welcoming and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine_yeo
Reviews.Content: Love the location as it was very central. The interior was clean, although the daily cleaning wasn't as good - they didn't change the sheets/towels unless we threw everything on the floor. No vacumming was done, although likely they swept the carpets (not sure how they did it though). Nice self-contained apartment with laundry,cooking and dishwashing facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended with staff who care. Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tom_G_47
Reviews.Content: We arrived a day late due to the ash cloud and despite prepaying I was told that we would be refunded as an act of good will. Could not have been happier at this point! We got the slightly more pricey loft apartment - a great room with an amazing view down onto George street and Haymarket. One slight hiccup was that the downstairs (yup the room has two levels!) was stuck on one channel but this was quickly fixed!) Unfortunately (as is typical with so many hotels) in room Wifi was not included - it looks like they have outsourced this operation to a firm that charges the earth -AU$20 is more than I pay a month for my broadband in the UK. I think that in the western world we are now at a stage when broadband should be included in the hotel price - its a basic utility like water or heat! Anyway rant over. We had a great stay and the staff were all very welcoming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, modern, central hotel with spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: galtons
Reviews.Content: Medium sized, modern hotel located close to Central Station, but surprisingly quiet. It is also close to Chinatown. I stayed in a studio apartment that was a good size with a desk and a reading chair. It contained a kitchenette with a microwave, sink and mini fridge. The decor was modern and welcoming. I had a king sized bed that was comfortable. The bathroom was clean and a good size. The small gym was adequate and there is an outdoor pool. The staff were helpful and friendly. I stayed there five nights and would stay there again. This hotel was good value for money compared to other Sydney hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious all suite hotel, right in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: dasberliner
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Medina Executive, I stayed here several years, and the location and size of the rooms was a driving force in choosing to stay here again. We stayed in a one bedroom apartment this time, whilst smaller than the 2 bedder we chose last time, the room was still huge, with oversized bathroom, lounge and bedroom. There are many cities that this room would be larger than most one bedroom apartments. There is a separate kitchen, lounge and bedroom, the main lounge area overlooking the street and railway square. The windows are not opening, but are double glazed, so you hear little noise from the busy road and railway station. Again this time I cannot fault the Medina, modern stylish dÃ©cor, set in a glorious old post office building make this a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay but avoid the Loft Apartments if you don't like stairs”
Reviews.Author: Lunarboogie
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a New York style loft apartment on the top floor and were initially giddy with good fortune. Then I had to lug a heavy suitcase up a steep and narrow internal staircase to get to the bed and that's where the novelty wore off. It was punishing. You sleep upstairs but the kitchen and everything else is down stairs. I was up and down more times than a yo-yo. Being young and fit, I took it in my stride but if I was older and more frail I wouldn't have been so understanding. Apart from that, everything else went swimmingly. The apartment was large, well appointed and meticulously clean. There is a full kitchen, including oven, which made baking an option. We didn't but the thought did cross my mine. There was even a washing machine and dryer which was very useful. The bed was large but unusually soft and the pillows were sadly disappointing. That said, the rooms were whisper quiet which is a real find in the heart of Sydney. The location is great. Close to China town and a myriad of other things and the service from the staff top notch. The gym looked good. I didn't try it but that's because I didn't need to. I had my own stair master in the room. The pool was of a good length too. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel - great staff, facilities, location”
Reviews.Author: traveloctopus
Reviews.Content: 2x nights in a studio apartment with my partner. Combination of business and leisure trip. Beautiful old building in a perfect location, as the business elements of the trip were all close to Central. Staff: friendly, cheerful Room: large for a studio. Comfortable bathroom, great bed to sleep on. Only fault is the TV remote didn't work. Facilities: didn't utilise, but they looked comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, could do with a few extra touches though”
Reviews.Author: MintTea
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a one bedroom apartment for several nights in February. The apartment was a very generous size with great kitchenette, living area, separate large bedroom with built in wardrobes and bathroom with a big shower and also a washing machine and tumble dryer. Towels were changed whenever you lay them out for changing and bedsheets were changed once a week. Unfortunately the apartment didn't appear to be vacuumed at all during our stay and neither was the kitchen floor mopped. The apartments have a very small gym which was fine as most of the time I was the only person in there, however there was no air-conditioning! I asked about this and the person said no one had every mentioned this before, hard to believe given that it was absolutely sweltering! There is also an outdoor pool and jacuzzi area, the pool was way too cold for me and also looked like it need a good cleaning out. The jacuzzi was ok but not powerful at all and again was a bit grimy looking. There were sun loungers in the area too but they too looked like they needed a good scrub. This area of the apartments should be one of its main features and as such should really be in pristine condition. The hotel location is great, right next to Central station from where you can travel to pretty much anywhere. It's also a good distance to stroll through the CBD up to Circular Quay. The nearest supermarket is about a 15 min walk away, otherwise you need to go to one of the extortionate convenience stores. Internet access in the apartments is some totally ridiculous fee, there is a $2/hour internet cafe across the road or you can do as I did and go to Vodafone and buy a broadband dongle. The staff working here were all very friendly but came across as very young and inexperienced and didn't seem very confident answering questions. Overall, these apartments are in a great location although are a bit on the steep side. The facilities in the apartment itself is good but make sure you find a supermarket to buy all your groceries etc. With a bit of extra attention overall then these apartments could be great.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for business or leisure travel”
Reviews.Author: go99go
Reviews.Content: This stay was to attend a business conference in Phillip St, Sydney but the location of the Medina allowed me to have a relaxing walk to and from the conference each day but then have many restaurants and leisure activities close by at the end of the day. The room was clean and well appointed. I requested an upgrade from the standard room to a one bedroom apartment (for a small fee) for a bit more space and got a loft apartment which was great as long as you don't mind stairs in the apartment - I had no objection. The building has some character and has a reasonable gym and good outdoor heated pool. I would recommend this hotel and certainly would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: apriliuliu
Reviews.Content: well equipped. good location. friend staff. i will select the hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, extremely overpriced but good location”
Reviews.Author: jwgooner
Reviews.Content: originally booked via phone 2 days prior to stay, gave credit card as security. on arrival was informed that the amount would be charged plus a $100 bond - on checkout providing no use of the overpriced minibar facilities this would be refunded. on checkout the amount was refunded (taking 5+ days to go through the banking system), but then the accomodation costs were charged - seems a real farce of a system and a quickfire way to use a lot of your credit limit. $26 for parking then a 1.5% credit card fee really just added to the overpriced statement. The keys we had for the lift and the rooms never worked, a real hassle for moving between floors and entering the room. reception fixed only one of our 4 keys. At around 10pm we asked the desk attendant check out time, he rudely stated that he would only tell us if we promised to no longer bother him and go to bed. For the price the room was vastly a lower standard than expected, no view and poor fittings. During our stay we did not manage to find the main light switch - a real hassle when you're trying to sleep in a frosted glass room. Location was good, right next to central. Pool/spa was a good standard, spent most of the next day in it. All in all a poor experience at this hotel, definitely would not be using the medina brand again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: hband3ts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bed and had booked by credit card direct by phone. Could not understand why management consistently called me during my stay asking for CC pre authoriosation..why did I give my CC number over the phone? Anyway location is excellent..Rooms are clean and tidy..Stupidly if you have friends staying..we had a friend in Penthouse and our key would not enable us access to the floor unless it was reprogrammed-bit silly. I did actually use the pool and it definitely needed treating and mentioned this to management that people were likely to get ear infections due to lack of chlorine levels in the water..It tasted fresh!! I did not see this rectified during my stay and it was not raining so abosultely no excuse and the pool was therfore unusable. I knoiw it sound slike a moan but all in all this place is in a great location..is well priced for families and is clean.

Reviews.Title: “Badly maintained”
Reviews.Author: chicqueen
Reviews.Content: Im not sure why anyone thinks the location of this Hotel is great. Its right by Central Station so getting to Circular Quay is good although its still 1/4 mile walk in the station, the walk to Darling Harbour is an unpleasent trip down a scruffy back-packer part of China town, not great with two young children. The apartment had a metal riser between the bedrooms and bathrooms that we all caught on feet on, the quality of the fittings is low, the carpets need replacing, lights were out, towels are minute and very thin, no robes, no view, the swimming pool is in the shade from 2pm although I dont suggest you go near it, the decking is coming apart and is lethal, my son needed stiches in his foot after cutting himself. The tiles around the pool are filthy with black grime. The plus is the staff were amazing on reception, very helpful!

Reviews.Title: “great service, great pool and other services”
Reviews.Author: gimme_tictacs
Reviews.Content: such a nice place to stay, great pool and gym. is recommended to everyone. very clean. will be staying there again. could not fault in anyway. friendly staff willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “excellent, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: gdanger
Reviews.Content: A really fantastic hotel, in a great location. It was our first time to sydney and got the train from the airport to central station- the hotel is less than a 2 minute walk, which worked perfectly for getting around sydney. The hotel upgraded us! we got the top floor and the room was simply beautiful, well decorated, clean and well equipt. The washing machine came in really useful too. the cafe next to the hotel does a great cup of coffee! We didnt use the pool, but it looked very nice. Staff were helpful and friendly. highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller004
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at short notice when "bumped" by another establishment.. What a surprise! Pleasant and helpful staff at reception, free upgrade, wonderful spacious, well equipped apartment with sensational view of city but no noise. Everything very clean and working properly. It's the wrong end of town for me when traveling on business, but I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jabbablue
Reviews.Content: Wonderful helpful staff, Quick check - in. Ideally located next to Central Railway station. Apartment spotless and well equipped. Will definitely stay here next time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Just_my_opinion_here
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice place to stay. We did not use the pool, but it was available (outdoor only) and spa is heated. Washing machine was convenient. The place has some kind of feeling of home - perhaps due to high ceilings, curtains (vs. blinds), and historic building exterior. The only drawback is that there is no convenient public transportation, and while it is at a walking distance to the harbor, it certainly takes time and energy. However, the walk is a nice way to experience the city on a short-stay trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but not if you need internet”
Reviews.Author: VisitingProfessor
Reviews.Content: Good value for money, everything you need is there but a good internet connection. After two days I decided to pay the prohibitively expensive fee anyway, but then all the cables were out! So I continued to frequent the nearby coffee houses where they have free wireless. I had one quibble on the water. They put out mineral water in the bathroom. I took that as a sign that the tap water is suboptimal. Then they wanted to charge me at check-out. I felt misled and they wavered the charge. In short, good hotel but not if you need internet.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC PLACE! Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: DrFluffy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two months while on a medical attachement at The Royal Hospital for Women. The staff were lovely, the rooms spotless, and the location perfect for exploring Sydney and for the buses and trains to escape to the many fantastic suburbs. I booked through opado and got a deal that was almost better than settling for a single room in a hostel! I had one of the split level appartments on the top floor, overlooking the pool and station. The balcony was small, but usable with a table and two chairs on it. The standard of furnishings and fittings was excellent, and I can not tell you how much of a dream it was having a cooker, dishwasher, microwave, washing machine AND tumble drier in the accommodation

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pjd190
Reviews.Content: Last leg of Australia trip w/ our 20 year old daughter. This lodging is in a converted post office- very high ceilings. Great location near train/bus station, close to Chinatown and ANZAC bridge, 10 minute bus ride to The Rocks, or AUD11 for 3 people in a cab. Great sleep- we were on 6th floor; ask for extra pillows. Shower head perfect height for someone 5 feet tall, but with long legs for the BIG step up into the tub. Had washer & dryer that vented into bathroom. Full kitchen. They add 1 1/2% service fee to any credit card use, and the attached cafe adds 4% for a room charge. 2 desktops and printer in lobby for internet access, or pay for internet use in room [NB- need a cable to connect to internet]. Don't miss the Botanic Gardens- magnificent!

Reviews.Title: “Good central location if you want to travel by train”
Reviews.Author: marg29
Reviews.Content: I think I expected too much from this hotel due to the great reviews I had read. The plusses were the pretty pool with surrounding trees and shade, pleasant staff the central location, although we also stayed in Darling harbour and much preferred that location, a neat little cafe/restaurant/pub attached next door to the Medina. Lovely period building. I was very disappointed with the room, we booked a studio and it was small and had a tiny cramped window at the side, although it was well soundproofed. The foyer internet was not working and there was no sign to indicate this, we had to find alternative at the Wake up hotel as staff did not have a clue where to send us. There a few facilities in the hotel, i.e. bar or in house restaurant although there are facilities to use a nice barbeque around the pool area. Nobody helped with suitcases in fact there was only one person running the whole reception when we arrived, he was friendly and polite but unable to help with luggage etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good for families - but don't get the loft”
Reviews.Author: GfamilyAustalia
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 2 or 3 times in the last few years with young kids and always found it excellent. However our kids are now five and three and our experience in the loft room was not great. The room was very big and roomy and on first glace looked idea. The problem was that the sofa bed (which the kids shared) sagged so badly that they kept rolling on top of each other and fighting. The air conditioning was also so lound it made the wall rattle (we seemed to be right next to the main cooling tower). The other major concern was that the banister on the top floor loft room was extremely easy for the 3 year old to climb and we had many dramas trying to stop her climbing up and falling down to the ground floor. I really think if the hotel is going to make this room available to children they need to change the banister to make it impossible for a small child to climb up and over it. Other than the problems with the loft ,I would recommend this hotel as it is very centrally located, with the bus, train and light rail all at the door. Its also only 15mins on the train to the airport. The rooms are stylish, large and the kitchen has all the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent apartment-style hotel with great location!”
Reviews.Author: maestrolms
Reviews.Content: This was the second Medina hotel I used on a recent vacation in Australia (the other was in Adelaide) and I was very pleased with my stays in both of them. There are a number of the Medina hotels in Australia, and they seem to be ones in which the outer shell of an older, often historic building has been completely refurbished inside to a format of one- and two-bedroom suites. The interior was very similar in both hotels, with a large living room with a dining area, separate bedroom, fully-equipped kitchen, and excellent bathroom including a washer/dryer combination. My room in Sydney was on the second-highest floor, on a corner, with three large windows offering superb views of the surrounding area. The location of the hotel was outstanding, being only a short walk from the Central Railway Station, so I was able to easily walk with my two pieces of luggage. There is also a convenient shuttle to the airport, a twenty-minute ride costing $12 AU. The rooms and the bed were very comfortable, and I enjoyed my three-day stay! Front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The only drawback was that the internet service was rather expensive - $27AU for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money, really quiet tp location, blissful beds”
Reviews.Author: GloriaSome
Reviews.Content: The Medina is situated right next to Central station giving great access to most of Sydney via trains. We bought Day Trippers and caught the train down to circular Quay where we toured all over Sydney via Ferry. The rooms are spacious and very well appointed, we all had an excellent night sleep despite being 20 feet from George Street. The beds Are wonderful, really comfortable

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel for many reasons!!!”
Reviews.Author: jjjad1281030
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel during our 2 week trip in Australia. We got a great deal at the last minute onOrbitz for a 2 BR,1 bath room (We actually needed to move from another hotel in Sydney). 24 hr. hotel staff were very friendly, helpful and with big smiles every time we approached/passed them. Room was more than we could imagine. Spacious 2 Bedrooms with large sitting area for working, watching TV, eating. Very clean and bright was simple, but elegantly decorated. Washer and Dryer in the bathroom which came in handy. Useful gym: 2 treadmills, bike, free weights, and Universal-like gym system plus towels, water. Great location! 2.5 blocks to Central Station where the FREE CBD shuttle bus (Route 555) got us around the City for sight-seeing, shopping, business and to connect with other transport. It will take you to (among others) Circular Quay, Darling Harbour, and the APPLE store (used by us, almost daily, for free internet and game playing-kids) . Hotel was walking distance to Paddy's Mkt , China town and the beautiful Capitol Theatre where we saw WICKED (got tickets for that evening's show at box office for much cheaper than in San Francisco). Husband and 11 year old son walked to Sydney /Football Stadium to see the New South Wales Waratahs play Rugby. We picked up delicious, inexpensive fresh fruit from Paddy's Mkt., and ate at great restaurants, cafes that were walking distance from the hotel. Would highly recommend this hotel and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable and affordable - the TTP in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: WeaselH
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights and it was the best choice of hotel I have ever made. It's been 7 years since I last visited Sydney but this hotel is right by the station - just down the road so you can jump off at Central coming from the airport or catch the train further up to get the Circular Quay etc. The hotel itself, I could not fault, nor the friendliness and knowledge of the staff - brilliant. The rooms were large, with a separate room joining for a shower and bath and in the main part of the bedroom there is a concealed fridge and microwave, Its not really a room for eating in but for keeping a few snacks it was perfect. The location is just so central I could not imagine staying in a better place and for the price I was so glad I opted for this rather than possibly a little more luxurious hotel that was further away. This has my 110% recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a bad location”
Reviews.Author: AJ&ERtravel
Reviews.Content: I share other reviewers' opinions. This is a very good value for money apartment hotel. We got an upgrade and had a very nice unit overlooking the main street. The room was well appointed and well serviced. The bed was comfortable and the staff always ready to assist and accomodate. The washer dryer worked well and the bathroom was bright and airy. We did get a moment to use the pool and that too was up to all expected standards. The only small gripe was a large notice above the cooking unit which threatened dire consequences, a $600 fine, if you set off the fire alarm. While understanding their point, I found it intimidating and hardly a comforting or encouraging incentive to cook a meal. Now, let's get to location. We are fit, we've both done marthons so don't tell us it's a forty-five minute walk to Circular Quay. At tourist pace it's at least an hour. And Darling Harbour is half an hour not fifteen minutes. We bought multi-use bus and ferry tickets but it's stll a long haul in big city traffic down to the waterfront. And what's this area you have walk through at the top of George and Pitt Streets? It's not dangerous or anything like that, just unpleasant. We did a check and noted - porn and pawn shops, low-end hostels, cash loan outlets, massage parlours, used military uniform shops and other outlets various and seedy. Maybe that's ok with you but next time we would like to walk through a nicer part of town. And I think we would pick somewhere a little closer to the tourist action.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else!”
Reviews.Author: Kelliebean27
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic hotel! I stayed here with my partner for our anniversary in October 2009 and I was pleasantly surprised. The staff were incredibly accommodating, taking care of our luggage before our room was ready and hauling our bags around with a smile. Our room was a 1 bedroom apartment that we booked on hotel.com with 40% off for booking a certain amount of days. It was fresh, modern and immaculately clean. Not being able to hire a car, the hotel was in a great location for us being next to Central Station and walking distance to all major takeaways, busses, trams, the monorail, shops, the aquarium, Paddys Markets, Darling Harbour and Imax. I was worried that being next to the train station, on a main intersection and next to a backpackers that noise would be an issue but didn't hear a thing. We were greeted with a smile from all front desk staff every time we walked in and out of the hotel no matter what time of day or night which is a fresh change from some other places I've stayed at! They went out of their way to help us with any questions we had and I'd have to say they're up there with the best hotel staff I've encountered. On the last day, between myself and my partner we had flowers and chocolates delivered to the hotel which all went smoothly and amused the staff! They were incredibly accommodating and let us hang around for a bit after checkout and took care of our bags again. To sum it up, 5/5. Great location, exceptional staff, clean and modern rooms and up to date facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, spacious rooms and pure comfort”
Reviews.Author: kaisnowbird
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in Sydney and have stayed at this hotel on two occasions, and have been delighted with everything the hotel has to offer. Through a friend of mine who had business relations with the hotel, I got us an extremely good rate the first stay (Feb 09). My friend told me beforehand that the rooms are big and much better than the hotel I had originally planned on staying at, which was right across the street. The premium one-bedroom apartment I booked at the Medina was HUGE!! The biggest "standard room" I had ever stayed in, apartment or other types of hotels. The living room had enough sofa and chair seating for 9 people!! The location was great and despite a lot of traffic and actions happening at its doorstep, the room was nicely quiet, soothing and comfortable - exactly what we needed on a busy, hot summer day upon arrival. It's a heritage building from colonial time, with excellent natural lighting. It had so many windows that I couldn't help but smile every time I walked in the living room. The layers of curtains also control the natural light. I found everything I needed in the kitchen, even a stove, an oven and a dishwasher. The bathroom was spacious and elegantly appointed, the wash and drier was nicely tucked away. Yes, the furnitures are not brand new, but they passed my extreme pickiness and my wife's expensive taste (and she worked in a hotel for years). The bedroom itself was of a good size too - not much smaller than a standard room I found in some budget hotels, and offered a decent view. I enjoyed the hotel so much that we came back 3-month later. I emailed the hotel and told them I got a great deal last time and they repeated the offer. The rate was slightly higher due to it being a higher season and I upgraded to a one-bedroom loft apartment, but the price was still fantastic. All the facilities and amenities were there. The room was great as usual. But I must say that the loft apartment I got was not neccesarily better than the one-bedroom apartment I got before. The privacy of the bedroom/loft from the living area was not as great, the lounge area was smaller (still very spacious and comfortable, but I wouldn't call it huge in capital letters), bathroom was of a standard size - not as big as before. The balcony was not great. We had late check-out on both occasions (not morning persons) and left our luggage for the friendly and polite reception desk to look after for hours and hours. On the second stay, we left things behind in the closet and had to go back. To our relief, the hotel staff had collected them and put them in a nice bag for us. To sum it all up - overall best hotel experience I have ever had and great value. It is so good to go back to a spacious room after an eventful day. Feels almost like home. The TVs could have been bigger, but at least we had two in each apartment. Every time we walk pass Medina Executive Central, it reminds us of the good times we've had there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and located next to Central Station"”
Reviews.Author: btober
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right next door to Central Station, so less than a five minute walk. I had reserved a studio, but was upgraded to a one bedroom apartment. This was a fantastic surprise. The living room with dining table for four, fully stocked kitchen including refrigerator and stove. The bathroom was equipped with a bath/shower and a washer/dryer located in a closet. The bedroom had a king sized bed (moderate comfort) with a safe and iron/ironing board. There were small televisions in both the living room and bedroom, although the channel selections were quite limited. My room had large windows overlooking Lee and George streets, but noise was not a factor. Everything was clean although beginning to have a slightly used feeling (tiny spots of mildew in the shower, small carpet stains). The staff at check in/out were very helpful and friendly. Check out time was 10am, but they extended that by one hour for me and also stored my bags for several hours as well. The hotel also had a small but nice outdoor pool. The fitness facility was located in a small room and only had a treadmill, cycling machine and a few free weights. The location is relatively safe and located fairly close to Chinatown (5 min) and Darling Harbour (10 min). A walk to Circular Quay and the Opera house would take about 20 minutes. There are a number of hostels in the area, so there is lots of foot traffic around, even in the evening. There is a Global Gossip internet shop a block away on George Street. Restaurant selection in the immediate area is not great and there are no supermarkets in the area. There are a few 7/11s next to the hotel. Paddy's Market is only a few blocks away, great place for souvenir shopping. Overall, I was greatly pleased with this hotel and would stay here again when visiting Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: kerry405
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 7 days at the Medina with my family including three relatively young children and loved it. The Medina is in a great location, close to everything. Central Station is on its door step, and China Town is within a very short walk. China Town offers great food, a great atmosphere and of course great shopping (including Paddy's Market). Circular Quay (ie., the transport hub for buses and ferries) is within a short bus trip (and there is a free bus which circles the inner Sydney hub). It's location is safe both during the day and at night, and of course, the hotel has good security. Staff are polite, helpful and friendly. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to families.

Reviews.Title: “great location not great area.”
Reviews.Author: taff72
Reviews.Content: I stayed here just last weekend. When I arrived the staff were welcoming and even though I was pretty early they were able to let me check into my room. The bedroom was a little small but the main loungeroom was pretty huge (corner) with views from about 4 windows. The area that the hotel's in isn't great, quite run down in fact. but it is in walking distance form the central station that can easily and quickly get you to the main points of Sydney - darling harbour, circular quay etc so no real problem there. would definitely stay here again if I was visiting when I had a problem with the service I'd booked to collect me to return to the airport, the staff were extremely helpful and arranged an alternative. Nothing seemed too much of a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a base.”
Reviews.Author: HappyGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July. Good place for a base in Sydney. Room was very large and had everything we could want, finished to a very high specification and completely sound proof. We did notice that our neighbour's room would have been 3-4 foot shorter than ours the way the corridor was, so the rooms are variable size (however 3/4 foot would of still left us with a big room!). See photos - I forgot to take photo of the very nice kitchen - sorry! Can not comment on the review below regarding 2nd bedroom. We stayed in one bedroom appartment which was superb. We also found the staff very helpful and friendly and knowledgable of getting places and recommendations. Finally, we were here as tourists. Can't really mark down location to much as it is central in Sydney so depends on what you want. Very close to railway station (tho you can not hear it), which made it excellent for day trip to Blue Mountains. Sydney is rather akward place to get around, but you can get a return to Circular Quay from Central with a few stops en route, with trains leaving every 2-3 minutes and taking about 5 minutes. Probably about 30 minute walk to Circular Quay and about 20 minute walk to Darling Harbour. You could base yourselves in Darling Harbour for a very tourist friendly area - but again, not sure how you could get around from there.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: Ozui
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews from here. My hubby and I have decided to book a 2 bedroom apartment for 6 nights. However, we simply have such an unpleasant experience upon checking in. Firstly, the 2nd bedroom in the unit was not a proper bedroom but merely a partitioned room with opaque glass panels which cannot be fully closed and the door is without a lock. And this room has no windows. Is that meant to be a storage room? ( REFER TO ATTACHED PICTURES) Secondly, the ventilation was not functioning at all. One can probably die of suffocation. (which explains why we decided to check out the very next moment) Lastly, the very poor service from the self-claimed "hotel manager" Jesse, who was unfriendly, unhelpful, rude and impatient made us think twice of ever coming back here again. Ended up we have to solve the problem by cancelling the remaining 5 nights and opted a better 4-star hotel instead. Medina - a 4* hotel? We asked ourselves again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families and the location is fine”
Reviews.Author: Thaiowl
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights in a two bedroom appt and found it great. The rooms were fine with everything you would expect from an appt. The cafe next door does nice breakfasts and has FREE wireless Internet. The Medina is next to the Central station and you can catch a tram to Paddy's Market and Darling Harbour. The buses stop virtually outside the Medina and you can hop on one to get to Circular Quay/Opera House/Sydney Tower. There are plenty of nearby places to eat/buy groceries. The staff are helpful, efficient and well trained. I would recommend the Medina.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location!!”
Reviews.Author: belinda68
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband and my 11 year old and 13 year old daughters. I wasnt sure about the location when I booked the hotel, but once we arrived there and got our bearings we found it to be a great location!!! It is right next door to the central train station and light rail (tram). We bought a family ticket for $50 for the monorail and light rail which was unlimited travel for a 3 day period for 4 people! What great value!! You also get discount vouchers for certain activities. We used it constantly to get around. We found the staff were very helpful when came to directions and transport etc. We checked in at around 6pm with no fuss. Also food outlets, there are numerous, especially if you like asian food!!! Also a short stroll to paddys markets with shopping centre above which includes an IGA store if you want to pick up a few things for your room!! Also in chinatown after 5pm there are street stalls that serve freshly cooked food which is cheap and great eating!! Lots of yum cha restaurants too if you like that sort of food too! There is also an internet cafe right across the road from the hotel plus a bus stop across the road if you want to go to circular quay or just to the city which we also found quite cheap! We had a 2 bed/2 bath apartment which we found was very nice, although it did lack a few kitchen essentials, like mixing bowls and not enough glasses etc!! We did find the air con a bit dodgy as it kept tripping out!!! It obviously had double glazing as we didnt find it noisy at all!! The only other thing we did notice was that every time you walked in your room you got that "cooking smell" from other rooms! We also had our own washing machine and dryer which I found very handy, although make sure you buy some washing powder as they charge $3 for a small sachet!! A lot of the "tourist" attractions are quite pricey, although the maritime museum is worth a visit. They have the "Endeavour, a destroyer, a submarine and a tall ship that you can walk through which we found very interesting, at cost of course!! If you want a cheap lunch at Darling Harbour there is a restaurant near the aquarium which has $10 lunches (basically pick from half a dozen things on the menu) which are huge!! Try the lamb kebab sticks with salad and chips, it is to die for!!! Overall, we were there for 5 nights and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! We would definitely stay at this hotel again! This hotel is also only about 5-10 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “nothing missing here”
Reviews.Author: kr_afol
Reviews.Content: I had a 1-bedroom loft apartment and pretty much anything you might have wanted was available in the apartment (very fully equipped kitchen, laundry, lounge, dining, bedroom, balcony). I didn't interact that much with the staff but the check-in and check-out were very friendly and efficient. The location, next to Central Station, with plenty of different priced eating nearby is hard to beat for convenience. Maybe not a great location for views, but great for getting around. The negative of the location was the traffic noise, which was no problem unless I opened the balcony door. I'd definitely consider staying there again and recommending it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: amarante1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Medina for one night and had no issues with anything within the hotel. We left our bags early with no hassles and didn't return till approx. 11pm where the 24hr service desk were lovely and had already taken our bags to the room. The room had lovely views of the city and its location (right next door to Central Station) made it very easy to get anywhere. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a nice weekend away or for a business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Business Types”
Reviews.Author: Woogieworld
Reviews.Content: The Sydney Medina Executive is a great hotel for business-types and couples. Famiiles will get great services, but read on to know what you will see.... We checked in early Monday morning and lucky for us our room was ready to go at 10:00 AM. Quite a bonus for a big family who was exhausted from a 14 hour flight from LA. We had prepaid through a major travel site for a week and were treated to a two bed/two bath apartment. While it will not have breathtaking views of the harbour, you will have a great location for everything else. The rooms themselves are quite open and spacious. One quirk is the bathrooms which you literally step up into (about 1/2 inch/1cm)) which at first causes a bunch of stubbed toes. After two days, you know the drill and don't think about it. The kitchen we had was spacious and the treats located int he fridge and elsewhere were not ridiculously expensive. Television had a limited number of channels (and in our room had two adult channels that were unlocked...not that we were watching them, but when flipping channels for little eyes...just make sure you change quickly!) I will warn you about the hotel's Internet. It is VERY pricey. Uploading pics and normal activities cost me well over $150AU for the entire week. I could have easily bought a broadband card and service for much less. If you are coming for any length of time, buy a broadband wireless card. There are very few open hotspots around the hotel. The hotel is located next to the station, but it is a bit of a walk to the train platforms. If you have kids or large luggage, I would suggest not taking AirportLink unless you feel comfortable walking several blocks. Rush hour is quite busy, so if you are doing any traveling do it early or late. Weekends and holidays are quite dead, so you will get around quite easily on the weekends. There are a host of student hostels and backpackers around Central, but the hotel security does a great job of keeping the place quiet and secure. There are a number of small shops and restaurants surrounding the hotel. There are at least five convenience stores open 24x7 within one block, no problems getting a Slurpee at 01:00. Central IS a train station, and the majority of its clients are business-folk, so don't expect a tourist haven here. You will get good service, but don't be surprised if you are surrounded by suits or business types looking at you strange with your "I HEART SYDNEY" shirt while waiting for a latte. Transport is easy, and gives you a wide variety of choices from buses to trains to taxis. Lee street is quite busy, so crossing at the walks is obviously recommended. You can also walk underneath the street taking advantage of the tunnels located next to the hotel. Overall the hotel is a great value, and I would definitely stay there again. The views aren't romantic, but you will get around the city pretty easily and if you don't mind sticking out a bit as a tourist, you will have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location right next to Central Station, comfy rooms,”
Reviews.Author: JacWasHere2009
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for one night but would definately stay longer. We arrived and departed in Sydney by train so the location right next to Central was very convenient for us. Our one bedroom apartment had a queen bed which we shared (not our preferred option but we managed to fit ok). The price we paid was $160 through Wotif.com which seemed good value for money considering the location. The apartment provided everything we needed although more shelving or cupboard space in the bathroom would be useful. Also, while there is a washing machine there isn't anywhere other than over the shower to hang wet bathers. No bath in our room type but who needs one when there is a spa downstairs. The pool/spa is nice and the gym seems well equipped. I also made use of the Gloria Jeans located conveniently across the road. I like apartment style accommodation because you are self sufficient and don't need to call room service to get a plate etc! Its a pleasant, fairly short stroll to the Queen St Mall, Darling Harbour and the lightrail at Central is very convenient. There are also lots of restaurants that deliver (info in room) if you want to stay in. Would recommend and stay again for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Superb accomodation, well located and great value”
Reviews.Author: Dougal1978
Reviews.Content: We paid about Â£75 a night for a five night stay in one of the loft apartments. It was in the business district rather than the Rocks but only a 5 minute bus ride there and you can walk to Darling Harbour in 10 minutes. Our apartment had a mezzanine bedroom which meant for a really high ceiling in the living room area, decent kitchen with proper cooker (not that we used it no one was able to direct us to a decent supermarket, there's one on Glebe Road we found on our last morning!) balcony with to be honest a crappy view over the railway station, but your in the middle of a city so not really there for views. Pool was fine for doing laps in the morning and if you're that obsessive a gym with basic equipment. I really enjoyed staying here and it was definitely a better choice than paying nearly twice as much for the travelodge in the Rocks. I would say if you're getting a loft apartment and staying a while make sure you get one with a decent balconyl; we saw into one of the other rooms which had a 15 foot high wall for a view....

Reviews.Title: “Room fantastic, great location.”
Reviews.Author: Dekoven
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment for two nights last weekend, and it was fantastic. Rooms were large and spacious, one with an ensuite. The apartment had a huge living/dining room and a full kitchen, massive windows and we didn't have any noise from Central Train Station which was a short walk away. It was a brilliant apartment, and perfect for a girls weekend and all for a very reasonable price. The location is very central, with Chinatown within walking distance and it was only a short walk to the centre of Sydney (Town Hall, QVB etc). Staff were really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate and well located, but what's the deal with the air-con?”
Reviews.Author: Zephyr71
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a Saturday night. Got a good price for one of the more basic rooms. Perfectly adequate for a short stay, though not spectacular. Front desk service was ok, but a little disinterested. My biggest complaint is the air conditioning. It's been fixed at 23 degrees, and you can't adjust it. Sorry Medina, but that's just too warm to sleep comfortably - what makes you think that the system is even calibrated right?

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: RubbinsRacing
Reviews.Content: Great location, right next to central station though you wouldn't know it as I never heard the trains. Small studio room was very clean. Bed was very comfortable. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Everything worked. Aircon was nice. Shower was awesome. Good rates. All good. Would recommend to all.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and well supplied”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: Securing what I thought was a good rate of A$120 for a studio on a Sunday night, I arrived quite late but quickly checked in. Its location only 150 metres (if that) from Central Station and its country and interstate trains plus Airport Train is a great feature. The room was quiet, even in the morning when there was a fair bit of traffic coming up George St. The window furnishings blacked out almost all light and were very good. While the bathroom was not huge, it had a full size bath and an efficient shower. The inbuilt main cupboard had a fridge with a fairly extensive minibar, along with a microwave plus crockery and cutlery. A generous number of complimentary teabags and coffee sachets were provided. There was a little noise from two other guests banging their doors at 0600 but this was over in a second or two. Lighting in the room was good although the TV could have been a little larger. The bed initially felt soft to touch but I slept well as it was comfortable, which for me means not too soft. I did not use the outside, heated lap pool or large barbeque but both looked adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable apartmnent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mostlyharmless
Reviews.Content: Comfortable hotel apartment, spacious, well-fitted out with new(ish) furnishings. Next to central railway station and busy street, but well-insulated from traffic noise. Location convenient for train station, but less so for places like Darling Harbour and Sydney Opera House - not within walking distance. You will need public transport options if you stay here. Kitchen adequate - basic cutlery and crockery, and minimal but basic cooking equipment. Rooms comfortable - had a two bedroomed apt, with one bathroom off the main sitting / dining room, and the other attached off the master bedroom. Centrally airconditioned, but the smaller room always was a bit stuffy. TV, internet access (fees apply) provided. Hotel has a lap-pool on ground floor, and a sauna / mini gym facility. Staff were friendly but not warm, and multiple requests for replacement of a missing soup bowl went unfulfilled - we gave up asking after the third day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TrishaClevedon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Medina for one week at the start of our three week holiday in Australia, and liked it so much we returned for a further three days before coming back to England. We had a two bedroomed apartment which was clean, bright and airy. The position of the hotel is really good with central station just round the corner and buses across the road.
