It is really easy to get to all the attractions as well as transport to places further afield (ie. Palm Beach, Hawkesbury river etc.) The staff, we found to be always polite and willing to help whenever required. Over all a great stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “A regular pick for me!”
Reviews.Author: Eklasse
Reviews.Content: As a Business traveller I have been booked into this Medina Executive quite regularly and enjoy the stay in nearly every case. The hotel is great and the apartments well appointed. Internet access in your room, tasteful furnishings and appointments would make this a great base for a few days. The kitchen is fully functional in most cases although there is one room in the hotel I have been placed in - which really is no bigger than a closet! Nearby are great food choices from quite cheap to pub meals and cafe style eating. Easy also to catch a cab and still close to the airport - make this a great choice at this end of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice For Disabled Travellers”
Reviews.Author: TrumpetsAreGreat
Reviews.Content: We are from Canada and stayed at the Medina Sydney Central for one month in March, 2004. Our requirements are very intense for hotel stays as my wife is disabled and has many special needs. Medina shone for us and the property and staff were outstanding. The apartment was very well appointed and the facilities in the building were excellent as well. Moreover, the location couldn't have been better or more central. We were within walking distance of many of Sydney's top attractions. We were initially concerned that the location so close to the central train station would be a problem but we barely heard the trains or any city noise from our suite. Highly recommend this property for anyone considering a long stay in Sydney. We loved this place so much that we are returning for another 3-week stay in March, 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome loft apartments!”
Reviews.Author: TravelrocksNz
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights in July/Aug 2008 in a one bed loft apartment. The apartment was very spacious, with a neat balcony overlooking the train station and a wooden staircase leading up to the bedroom and bathroom. Having your own laundry was a bonus, having to pay for washing powder was not! The staff on the whole were very helpful and friendly. The sauna, heated outdoor pool and spa were excellent. Swimming whilst looking up at the stars whilst in the centre of Sydney can't be beaten really! The location right next to central train station is excellent and there was no problem with any noise from the trains or from anything else. My only niggles were paying for the washing powder, the kitchen floor was dirty for some reason and the doona was dirty although they did replace this promptly. Our TVs didn't have remotes but these were supplied promptly upon request. The main gripe was the security cards needed to access the room and lifts. They just didn't work! We took them back countless times for them to be replaced, reloaded etc, but countless times, we were stranded in the lift or outside our room or even outside the building coming home at night!! They really need to address this issue!! Other than that though, this place can't be faulted and we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: austrip
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Medina Executive Central. We stayed in a 2 bedroom apartment which was very clean and spacious.. The hotel is right next to Central Rail Station but you don't hear any noise from the trains. We went to Sydney to see the show Billy Elliott, this hotel was ideally located being only 5 minutes walk from the Capitol Theatre. There is a cafe under the building where you can have a nice breakfast. It is close to transport and shops. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Covenant
Reviews.Content: If you want a serviced apartment in central Sydney this could be the one for you. My room was spacious and clean and had all the amenities one would expect. The location is great being right next to the Central Station at the junction of George St and Pitt St. I have only one niggle and that is the amounts that are charged for minor items like crisps. And why do I have to pay for the washing powder in the room?

Reviews.Title: “This is such a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: laurence_baillie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Sydney but that was just the best value for money ever. My parents and I stayed in a two bedroom appartment which was clean, modern and spacious. Our experience there from the minute we stepped in was great. The staff at the reception was so professional, helpul and friendly, I can't fault them for anything. Plus you are in the middle of it all near Central, with all the buses going to the Quay, monorail to Darling Harbour etc etc. There are heaps of shops and restaurants and you are minutes walk from funky Newtown if you want other restaurant options. Plus you save heaps as you can have your brekkie in the comfort of your own kitchen or cook dinner or have it delivered. What more can you ask for? Highly highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old post office building transformed”
Reviews.Author: dasberliner
Reviews.Content: So the Medina Executive lives up to it's name. Its set in a glorious old post office building, and rooms are all apartments, and our room was a two bedder. Renovations are of a high standard and decor is very nice. This place has a 'move right in' feel to it. Location is a good, just near Broadway and Chinatown and Paddy's markets are less than 10 mins away

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to CBD, Chinatown, Oxford St & Darling Harbour”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller5000
Reviews.Content: The Medina is well located adjacent to Central railway station; the rooms were spacious enough and the hotel had excellent facilities, however the staff really need a course in manners. The hotel's turn of the century exterior (~1913) hides the modern 21st century interior, which has been soundproofed to some degree (our room was opposite the bus interchange on the South side of the building and whilst we heard no traffic noise, the occasional bus rumble was audible but even I [a very light sleeper] slept through the night without noise disturbance. We liked the gym & pool, room safe, reasonably priced mini bar & thoughful features such as iron & board. We were disappointed to see that our booking far in advance for a twin room for our business weekend in Sydney (which reception had read & ignored when allocating rooms and then again when we checked in) meant that we were downgraded without compensation or apology from an apartment on the 4th floor to a standard hotel-bedroom style room on the 2nd floor to fulfill the request.. When we pointed out that the room they'd tried to assign us at check in (2 male business colleagues) was a "double" not a "twin" the check in staff made a rude & unhelpful suggestion that we share. Rather than cause a (deserved) scene, we said we'd check in later in the day when other rooms were free & asked to ensure the room or bedding was changed. Was happy that we were within walking distance of so much, and adjacent to the Station, bus & light rail to go just about anywhere else. Would probably stay here again if work demanded, but much cheaper well equipped rooms (with politer staff) are to be had in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great as long as you don't need to request favours at reception!”
Reviews.Author: Mee65
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Medina Executive in Sydney for our honeymoon in September 2007. Even thought the hotel knew we were on honeymoon, we didn't get any compliments like a bottle of wine or a card like some other hotels provided. The room on the fourth floor was absolutely immaculate. You walked into a kitchen with a spacious lounge with a sofa and TV, and on the other side was a bathroom with a bath/shower and cupboard with washing machine and dryer. Opposite that was the bedroom which had a huge wardrobe and a TV. Could not fault the appartment in any way. However, there were some problems from our 5 night stay which I'd like to highlight. 1) We had a lot of valuable property and therefore we would have liked to have used the safe which was allocated in our room. However, every time we tried to use it, it wouldn't work due to the battery being low. We contacted reception who were extremely friendly and polite and sent a message through to the handyman for him to change the battery. A day passed and no new battery. We asked at reception again and was assured that the handyman would change the battery for us immediately.... two days passed and still no new battery in the safe!!! 2) Washing power, charged at $2.50 for two small packets. We needed to do some more washing at the end of our trip, and as we had run out of washing powder, I left a note for the cleaner to leave us a new packet. Wasn't done. Next morning I caught her in the corridor and asked her about it, she said that I needed to ask at reception, she didn't use her own initiative to phone reception herself when she first read my note. So we asked at reception and was assured that washing powder would be sent up to the room immediately........... dum dee dum ...... hours later, no washing powder!!!! I went back down to reception and asked where the washing powder was, almost begging him for washing powder as we were leaving the appartment in the morning and needed time to wash and dry the clothes. He once again spoke to the porter on the phone asking him to do it ... when we came back we finally had some washing powder, it was like a miracle had happened! But why should we have to ask about four or five times almost to demanding point for things to be done at the hotel???? In the end I was up until way past midnight trying to dry clothes off because of the laziness of the staff. Next thing: we had someone else's bill come through our door. We went to reception to explain that the bill had been delivered to us by mistake and that we are not room 50, but room 60. The guy on reception apologised and then crossed off 50 on the bill and put 60 instead! We kept saying to him "But this is not our bill! It was put under our door by mistake!", but he apologised and said he didn't understand and asked for us to speak to someone else at reception! The TV channels: on our bedroom tv, there were two porographic sex channels which had no warning or restrictions on them. Children could very easily have access and view them, so BE CAREFUL!!!!!!!!!!!! Overall, would I stay there again? No, because the personal service at the hotel is extremely poor.

Reviews.Title: “Handy, but still out of the way”
Reviews.Author: spe18z
Reviews.Content: These apartments had pretty good reviews, so we booked. We arrived at 10am, knowing we wouldn't get our room which was no problem as the wife was going shopping until mid afternoon. Arrived back around 2.30 but our room was still not ready. Had to wait a short time which was a little dissapointing. The room was not quite what we expected but had everything we needed. Something I have learnt is never trust hotel photos, as the room was a lot smaller. Most of the fixtures and fittings weren't in the best condition. Most of the furniture was really marked/damaged. The location to central station is why we booked, but to be honest by the time you get into the platforms you have nearly walked half way to the town hall. So in hind site a hotel nearer the town hall may have been better. But overall the stay was fine, but not worth the high end cost.

Reviews.Title: “Whisper quiet, spotless, what a location”
Reviews.Author: WollongongSheila
Reviews.Content: Up to the city for a show night, how handy is this hotel, right on Central station but the sandstone walls and double glazing block all but the occassional train horn. Step out the door onto the main city bus terminal. The 1 bedroom apartment had everything, you could stay here and prepare your own meals and even do the laundry. However, laundry was not on our agenda! Staff were friendly and helpful. Getting in and out of the bath/shower was higher than usual and this could be difficult for someone not able to make the awkward step in, but apart from that I would certainly recommend the place to someone who seeks centrality and a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - check the prices though”
Reviews.Author: ManxQueenies
Reviews.Content: Many of the comments of other travellers I'd re-iterate - fair location (though easy walking distance to Darling Harbour), local roads can be a bit hectic to cross - but right by the train station. Apartment (I booked a Premier loft apartment ) was great - over 2 floors and lovely wrap-round balcony at top of hotel. Very boutique in style and all mod cons such as dish washer and washer/dryer. Staff very pleasant and helpful at check in - our room was not ready at 7am (that would have been too much to expect), but fully serviced and ready by lunch time, bags stored and delivered to room whilst we went out for breakfast. Small but pleasant pool and gym - fuctional and a bonus for in town. Did get a good rate of AUD235 a night - but noticed it was available at only AUD201 on a late booking site - good on the hotel they agreed to the reduced rate. Overall - would definately stay again if returning to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish accomodation in central Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SmartTraveller
Reviews.Content: My 1 bedroom apartment was spacious, light filled and well equipped/furnished. Best of all, despite the location, it was dead quiet as the windows are double-glazed. The location is great - right next to Central Station, a quick walk to China Town and buses outside the door to the heart of downtown Sydney. However, NOT an area that a single female would want to walk alone at night. As another reviewer mentioned, pillows are ordinary. have had worse but also a lot better! King size bed was very comfortable with crisp sheets and a doona The big let down was room service. When it arrived, it was very nice food at some of the cheapest prices I have seen in a quality hotel. Getting it, however was farcical. Phones not answered, three trips to the room to deliver one dinner (dinner, drink and bill to be signed all arrived with different people). The hours stated on the menu were 7 am to 9 pm but when I rang for a late lunch around 3 pm, I was told they were closed. Despite this, I really enjoyed my stay at the Medina

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Arncliffegirl
Reviews.Content: Fabulous apartment hotel - really well equipped, obliging staff, terrific pool. Spotlessly clean, full kitchen facilities, very comfortable bd. Right on transport, but whisper quiet. Would love to be able to open windows though. Fantastic use of heritage building.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the carless business man”
Reviews.Author: Aroborus
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in Sydney on business during the week then the Medina Executive Sydney Central is literally a stones throw from Central Station, and only a short cab ride from the centre of town. The rooms are contempoary in design and well maintained. But as we found in other Medina hotels, the pillows are down right terrible. There is no pillow menu, and the choice is limited. In-room menu is good and not too expensive. Careful, it does not operate on weekends (Friday-Sunday) as we found out (no mention of this in the room directory) and you are forced to use a restaurant delivery service. Parking is limited, but the train is close. That does not tend to give a picture postcard view, but the rooms have little road noise. Is it value for money? Not a full rack rate. There are better value hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Meriton is better value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd rate it as average only because we were comparing it to the Meriton Rialto apartments, which we had to leave as they were fully booked for our second week. The Medina was, $30 more a night, had the noise from the train and nearby youth hostel, further from centre of town, charged for washing powder(!?!), cable tv channels, and was double the price for internet. Beds weren't as comfy and the decor wasn't as bright as the Meriton.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Apartment”
Reviews.Author: tenith
Reviews.Content: I loved staying here- we were upgraded which was wonderful, the apartment was spacious with all the mod cons, stylishly decorated. The only downfall was the limited parking and I didn't feel it was all that secure- open air with no security .

Reviews.Title: “My favorite Apt. hotel in Australia”
Reviews.Author: magmagrill
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel twice, once in 2001, and later 2004. We loved it. When we were first there we were moving out of the Waldorf Apts which were awful and for less money found this one. Our rooms were beautiful with lots of space and high ceilings. The next time we arrived into Sydney at 7:30 am after a very long flight from the states and they got our apt. ready by 10am. Really very nice people. Well located but you do need to use the buses to get around. That is no problem as they stop outside. I would stay here any time we are in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Medina Sydney Central. The stay was a great one - my apartment was available, so staff allowed me to check-in at 10:30am. The apartment was spacious and well-equipped - CD player, two bathrooms (I was in a two bedroom), more than ample towels, good sized TV in main (and smaller TVs in other bedrooms). Kitchen facilities were good. Location was great - a stone's throw from Central Station (did not notice any noise, though). The building has been well-restored and is very attractive. No issues arose throughout my stay - all went well. A great property with very pleasant staff. Would stay there again.

HotelInfo.Name: Medina Executive Sydney Central
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Lee Street | Haymarket, Sydney, New South Wales 2000, Australia
